subject: Home & DIY
title: Barcelona Chair: Fit for a King
description: Learn Barcelona Chair: Fit for a King in one minute.

hook.text: Mies van der Rohe designed the Barcelona Chair for a king who never sat in it. It became the 20th century's throne.

buildup.text: Built for the 1929 Barcelona Exposition, it was meant for King Alfonso XIII to sit in at the German Pavilion.

discovery.text: Two X-shaped chrome frames support leather cushions with no visible screws. The geometry is pure and mathematical.

twist.text: Each frame was hand-ground from a single piece of stainless steel. Mass production wasn't possible until the 1950s.

climax.text: The chair appears in every corporate lobby and design magazine. It signals taste and wealth without saying a word.

punchline.text: A king's chair now thrones every lobby.

quiz.question: For what occasion was the Barcelona Chair originally designed?
options: A commission from the Museum of Modern Art
Ludwig Mies van der Rohe's own home
